str2: Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary, but obsolete omo, for which another prolonged form omoo is used in certain tenses; to swear, i.e. Take oath.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Hair (of the head or of animals). Genitive case trichos, etc. of uncertain derivation; hair.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Black. Apparently a primary word; black.
